N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.15 - Release of the applicant

State Regulations
(a) The
commissioner may, within the 20-year period after completion of construction of
the facility, or within the period during which the applicant agreed to operate
the facility, release the applicant, in whole or in part, from its obligation
to continue the operation of the facility as an OPWDD certified facility as set
forth in its application; provided, however, that if the facility is subject to
an HFA mortgage said release shall require the written concurrence of the New

York State Housing Finance Agency. (b) The decision to make such release shall
take into consideration the extent to which: (1)
assurance is received that the facility
will be devoted by the applicant to another public use which will promote the
purposes contained in articles 13 and 41 of the Mental Hygiene Law; or
(2)

There are reasonable
assurances that for the remainder of the 20-year period, or the period during
which the applicant agreed to operate the facility, other facilities not
previously utilized for the care of persons with developmental disabilities
will be so utilized and are substantially equivalent in nature and extent for
such purposes. Notes
